studyMetadata.title: Data Serialization Formats Study
studyMetadata.description: A User Study on the usability of Data Serialization Formats.

reading-task-config-json-1.instruction: Please read the data in code editor and answer the following questions. (If needed, click the top-right help button to review syntax rules.)

response.prompt: 1. What is the value of the "version" key in the JSON file?
Are you sure to submit your answer?

Are you sure to submit your answer?

modifying-task-config-json-1.instruction: Please modify the JSON data in the code editor according to the requirements listed in the sidebar. (If needed, click the top-right help button to review syntax rules.)

response.prompt: 1. Ensure that the "vega" value in "peerDependencies" always matches the "version" value while preserving the caret (^) prefix.
Are you sure to submit your answer?

modifying-task-config-json-2.instruction: Please modify the JSON data in the code editor according to the requirements listed in the sidebar. (If needed, click the top-right help button to review syntax rules.)

response.prompt: 2. Add the keys "d3-hierarchy" with value "^3.1.2", "d3-interpolate" with value "^3.0.1", and "d3-path" with value "^3.1.0" under the "dependencies" section.
Are you sure to submit your answer?

modifying-task-config-json-3.instruction: Please modify the JSON data in the code editor according to the requirements listed in the sidebar. (If needed, click the top-right help button to review syntax rules.)

response.prompt: 3. Go through the JSON data and remove all "url" key-value pairs from the objects, no matter where they are.
Are you sure to submit your answer?

modifying-task-config-json-4.instruction: Please modify the JSON data in the code editor according to the requirements listed in the sidebar. (If needed, click the top-right help button to review syntax rules.)

response.prompt: 4. Modify the JSON structure by transforming the "collaborators" list into an array of objects, where each collaborator is represented as an object with a "name" key. Each original collaborator string should become the value of a "name" key within its respective object.
Are you sure to submit your answer?

writing-task-NL.description: writing task with natural language data
writing-task-NL.instruction: Before learning the syntax rules of data serialization formats and completing the related tasks, please look at the image and type out the text as it appears.

response.prompt: Are you sure to submit your answer?
Do you want to explain your answers? If yes, please provide your explanation.
Is there anything you’d like to tell us?
What is your highest level of education or the degree you are currently pursuing? (High School, Bachelor's, Master's, PhD, etc.)
How many months of programming experience do you have, including professional training, formal education, and self-learning? (Please enter a number in months.)
How would you describe your level of familiarity with package.json files?
Can you specify your familarity with the following data formats?
answerOptions: Heard of it but never used

response.prompt: Do you have any cognitive conditions that might affect how you perceive visual information?
options: No, I do not have any cognitive-related conditions.
Dyslexia (e.g., difficulty reading or distinguishing symbols, such as "b" and "d").
Dysgraphia (e.g., difficulty with handwriting or written expression).

response.prompt: Do you experience any vision conditions that may affect your ability to interpret text or symbols?
options: No, I do not have any related conditions.
Color vision deficiency (CVD) (e.g., difficulty distinguishing colors like red and green).
Low vision (e.g., difficulty seeing clearly, even with corrective lenses).
Blindness (e.g., unable to see or severe visual impairment).
